properties.areaDesc: Clear Lake/Southern Lake County; Southern Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Western Plumas County/Lassen Park; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Northern Lake County; Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County; Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
* Snow: 2 to 6 inches of snow expected above 4000 to 5000 feet
with locally higher amounts approaching a foot over the higher
peaks of the southern Cascade Range.

* Rain: Generally a half inch to around an inch over the foothills
and mountains. Less than a third of an inch across the
Sacramento Valley with little or no measurable precipitation
across the northern San Joaquin Valley.

* Timing: Late tonight into early Wednesday. Heaviest
precipitation expected Tuesday.

* Impacts: Travel delays with wet roads, and chain controls for
the Trans-Sierra passes possible for Tuesday afternoon and
evening.

* Synopsis: A Pacific storm will bring rain and mountain snow to
interior NorCal late tonight and Tuesday. Rain diminishes in the
Valley Tuesday night, while mountain snow showers will linger
into Wednesday.

NWSheadline: Wet Weather returns late tonight into early Wednesday
